intro: Asperula cunninghamii, commonly known as the mountain heather, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in well-drained conditions. It is often found in alpine or subalpine regions, where it forms dense, low-growing shrubs. Asperula cunninghamii is valued for its ornamental appeal and its ability to withstand harsh environmental conditions.
